lead_paragraph: Hours after being named in a lawsuit to enable the workers to bargain collectively, Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo renounced a loophole in federal labor law that has left them unprotected.

headline.print_headline: Farmworkers Sue Cuomo; He Then Joins Their Cause
headline.main: Sued, Cuomo Says He Supports New York Farmworkers’ Right to Organize

snippet: Hours after being named in a lawsuit to enable the workers to bargain collectively, Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo renounced a loophole in federal labor law that has left them unprotected.
abstract: New York Gov Andrew M Cuomo expresses support for collective bargaining rights for 60,000 New York farmworkers and says state will renounce loophole in federal labor laws that prevents farmworkers from organizing; statement comes after New York Civil Liberties Union files complaint in State Supreme Court contending inability of New York farmworkers to organize violates State Constitution.
